challenge(uint256,bytes32).details: The block number parameter is necessary for the contract to verify the challenge window,      since the contract cannot access the block number of the commitment.      The function reverts if the caller does not have a bond or if the challenge already exists.

params.challengedBlockNumber: The block number at which the commitment was made.
params.challengedHash: The data commitment that is being challenged.

params.challengedBlockNumber: The block number at which the commitment was made.
params.challengedHash: The data commitment that is being challenged.

params._bondSize: The amount required to post a challenge.
params._challengeWindow: The block interval during which a commitment can be challenged.
params._resolveWindow: The block interval during which a challenge can be resolved.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

resolve(uint256,bytes32,bytes).details: The provided pre-image data is hashed (keccak256) to verify that it matches the challenged commitment.      The function reverts if the challenge is not active or if the resolve window is not open.

params.challengedBlockNumber: The block number at which the commitment was made.
params.preImage: The pre-image data corresponding to the challenged commitment.

params._bondSize: The amount required to post a challenge.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

unlockBond(uint256,bytes32).details: The function reverts if the challenge is not expired.      If the expiration is successful, the challenger's bond is unlocked.

params.challengedBlockNumber: The block number at which the commitment was made.
params.challengedHash: The data commitment that is being challenged.

params.challengedBlockNumber: The block number at which the commitment was made.
params.challengedHash: The hash of the commitment that is being challenged.
params.status: The new status of the challenge.

balances(address).notice: A mapping from addresses to their bond balance in the contract.

bondSize().notice: The amount required to post a challenge.

challenge(uint256,bytes32).notice: Challenge a data commitment at a given block number.

challengeWindow().notice: The block interval during which a commitment can be challenged.

challenges(uint256,bytes32).notice: A mapping from challenged block numbers to challenged hashes to challenges.

deposit().notice: Post a bond as prerequisite for challenging a commitment.

getChallengeStatus(uint256,bytes32).notice: Returns the status of a challenge for a given challenged block number and challenged hash.

resolve(uint256,bytes32,bytes).notice: Resolve a challenge by providing the pre-image data of the challenged commitment.

resolveWindow().notice: The block interval during which a challenge can be resolved.

unlockBond(uint256,bytes32).notice: Unlock the bond associated wth an expired challenge.

BalanceChanged(address,uint256).notice: An event that is emitted when a user's bond balance changes.

ChallengeStatusChanged(bytes32,uint256,u.notice: An event that is emitted when the status of a challenge changes.

RequiredBondSizeChanged(uint256).notice: An event that is emitted when the bond size required to initiate a challenge changes.

BondTooLow(uint256,uint256).notice: Error for when the challenger's bond is too low.

ChallengeExists().notice: Error for when attempting to challenge a commitment that already has a challenge.

ChallengeNotActive().notice: Error for when attempting to resolve a challenge that is not active.

ChallengeNotExpired().notice: Error for when attempting to unlock a bond from a challenge that is not expired.

ChallengeWindowNotOpen().notice: Error for when attempting to challenge a commitment that is not in the challenge window.

InvalidInputData(bytes32,bytes32).notice: Error for when the provided input data doesn't match the commitment.

WithdrawalFailed().notice: Error for when the call to withdraw a bond failed.

userdoc.notice: This contract enables data availability of a data commitment at a given block number to be challenged.         To challenge a commitment, the challenger must first post a bond (bondSize).         Challenging a commitment is only possible within a certain block interval (challengeWindow) after the         commitment was made.         If the challenge is not resolved within a certain block interval (resolveWindow), the challenge can be         expired.         If a challenge is expired, the challenger's bond is unlocked and the challenged commitment is added to the         chain of expired challenges.
